clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Vertebral Manipulation and Pain Education in Chronic Neck Pain
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Vertebral Manipulation and Pain Education in Chronic Neck Pain

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to investigate the effects of vertebral manipulation and pain education on subjects with neck pain. For this purpose, 90 subjects who present chronic neck pain will be selected and allocated randomly into 2 groups: vertebral manipulation group and pain education group.

primary_outcome.description: Intensity of pain will be measured by the numeric pain rating scale (NPRS)

secondary_outcome.description: Level of concentration of pro and anti-inflammatory cytokines
Pressure pain Threshold will be measured with a digital algometer
Disability will be measured by the Neck Disability Index (NDI)
Fear Avoidance will be measured by the Fear Avoidance Beliefs Questionnaire (FABQ)
Quality of Life will be measured by the 12-Item Health Survey (SF-12)
Kinesiophobia will be measured byTampa Scale for Kinesiophobia
Intensity of pain will be measured by the numeric pain rating scale (NPRS)

arm_group.description: High-velocity and low-amplitude (HVLA) manipulation techniques to the cervical and thoracic region and pain education. The subjects will receive the treatment twice a week, for four weeks, totaling eight sessions, with an average duration of 30 minutes.

Pain education and a simulation of spinal manipulation (sham), involving manual contact over the cervical and thoracic region totaling 10 minutes. The subjects will receive the treatment twice a week, for four weeks, totaling eight sessions, with an average duration of 30 minutes.

intervention.description: High-velocity and low-amplitude (HVLA) manipulation techniques to the cervical and thoracic region
Subjects will receive pain education based in biopsychosocial approach
A simulation of spinal manipulation (sham), involving manual contact over the cervical and thoracic region totaling 10 minutes.
